snippet: At the latest 10-foot-deep crater, residents traded stories, like the time when a Cadillac cruised along 78th Street only to fall into a big hole.
abstract: Sinkhole measuring 30-feet-wide and 10-feet-deep opens on a street in Bay Ridge, Brooklyn, drawing a crowd of onlookers; many longtime residents recall similar craters from years past; city officials say the sinkhole opened up after a 112-year-old sewer pipe burst.
lead_paragraph: At the latest 10-foot-deep crater, residents traded stories, like the time when a Cadillac cruised along 78th Street only to fall into a big hole.

headline.seo: At a Bay Ridge Sinkhole, Neighbors Fret, and Reminisce
headline.main: At a Bay Ridge Sinkhole, Neighbors Fret, and Reminisce
headline.print_headline: At a Bay Ridge Sinkhole, Neighbors Reminisce
